title: 107_hr5404
content: The "Social Security Fairness Act of 2002" is cited as the short title. It amends the Social Security Act to address the computation and payment of the last monthly insurance benefit terminated by death. The "Social Security Fairness Act of 2002" amends the Social Security Act regarding the computation and payment of the last monthly insurance benefit terminated by death. It specifies that if an individual dies within the first 15 days of a month, their benefit for that month will be 50% of the original amount, rounded up to the nearest dollar. This provision applies after all other adjustments to the benefit have been made. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust wife's insurance benefits by changing the end date to the month of death. Subparagraphs are also reorganized. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust husband's insurance benefits by changing the end date to the month of death and reorganizing subparagraphs. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust child's and widow's insurance benefits by changing end dates and reorganizing subparagraphs. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust widow's, widower's, mother's, and father's insurance benefits by changing end dates and reorganizing subparagraphs based on remarriage or death. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust insurance benefits based on remarriage or death, by changing end dates and reorganizing subparagraphs. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust disability insurance benefits, benefits at age 72 for certain uninsured individuals, and exemption from maximum benefit cap. Exemption from maximum benefit cap is granted regardless of benefits received under specific sections upon an individual's death. Additionally, lump-sum death payments are increased. Section 202(i) of the Social Security Act is amended to update the applicable dollar amount for calendar years and the Commissioner of Social Security's role in determining and publishing it. Security will determine and publish the applicable dollar amount for the next calendar year in the Federal Register by November 1. The amount is calculated by multiplying $955 by the ratio of the national average wage index for the year before to the index for 2001. If the result is not a multiple of $5.00, it will be rounded up to the nearest multiple of $5.00. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for deaths occurring after 90 days from the enactment date.
